name: Maldron Hotel Smithfield

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a great value for the area it is in. Not too much right in the area, but a 10-15 min walk brings you right into the great areas of city centre. Right next to the hotel is a great gourmet super market for snacks, breakfast and lunch.
reviews.title: Great choice for a city hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were spotless, large, great showers in the bathroom. Overall- a great place to stay!
reviews.title: Way above expectations

likes.disliked: — no vegetarian food selections in restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful experience here. The luas is right next to the hotel so you can get anywhere from Smithfield and the Museum of Ireland is within walking distance, as well as everything else. The grocery next door is perfect and has a great deli selection. The cafe to the right of the hotel by the Luas is wonderful as well. The hotel staff was wonderful and the rooms were extremely clean and modern and comfortable. I will definitely be staying here again when I return to Dublin!
reviews.title: Good value modern business hotel

likes.liked: — Large room, convenient location for price
likes.disliked: — Door rattles and wakes you up in the morning :(

reviews.text: We stay in 4* hotels all the time for whilst on holiday in europe. This hotel stacked up to a 4* in many ways but let itself down in a couple, sadly...
reviews.title: Fab Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was nice and modern and the room comparitively large. comfy bed, good location - so far no issues.
reviews.title: Great hotel but watch the check in staff!

likes.liked: — The quality of the rooms and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Comfort Inn Smithfield is an excellent choice for value minded travelers. The clean rooms and helpful staff provide a welcome retreat after a day of sightseeing. Although out of the main shopping and restaurant area, public transportation is close and walking preferred. Most tourist sights are within a 20-25 minute walk.
reviews.title: Good value in pricey Dublin
Good choice in Dublin
reviews.text: A large, well-stocked market and deli is next door. The Cobblestone, one of the best pubs in Dublin for live music, is adjacent.

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.text: There is more than one Comfort Inn in Dublin. Be sure to specify Smithfield.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed for 2 nights at the Comfort Inn Smithfield in Dublin and found it to be a good choice for our needs. The hotel itself is brand new and spotlessly clean and very quiet. The
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room we had was large enough with a double bed and a single bed and overlooked the front courtyard. We did not try the restaurant in the hotel, but it seemed to be open early in the morning until quite late at night, and there were always alot of people using it.
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.text: Met up with some old school friends over Christmas and decided we would locate ourselves in the city to make things fair.
reviews.title: Only location saved the trip

likes.disliked: — The staff, especially reception and also the cost. Far too expensive for service provided

reviews.text: Having been the one to make the bookings, I was horrified at how thing went during our stay. The staff were indifferent and on both occasions we asked for directions, they were unable to help.... Not good for a city centre hotel.!!
reviews.title: Was adequate but expensive -

likes.disliked: — The shower arrangement and the hard beds

reviews.text: The reservations were all mixed up. The double rooms got twins and the twins got doubles. I had called days in advance to make sure there were no problems and were paying top rates. Too high as it turns out.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Affortable luxury
reviews.text: We foolishly asked the girl at reception to make us a dinner reservation in a well know restaurant in the centre of town and when we arrived that evening, there was no reservation for us. Thankfully they finally accommodated us, but the whole episode was embarrasing. It's probably a good thing that I cannot remember the receptionists name
In future we'll stick to where we know and will not be returning to the Comfort Inn.
reviews.title: Great choice for Dublin

reviews.text: This is a nice new, clean, modern hotel in a good location, with friendly staff at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: weekend in Dublin

reviews.text: The most negative thing is the distance from the centre of Dublin. But that is not really a problem for us, the maybe 20 minute walk was nice. The weather was great for the 3 days we where there. But there is a tram stop is not far if you just don't want to walk or its raining. I hear is rains in Ireland, although it did not for the 8 days we were there.
reviews.title: great hotel
Very good hotel.. good value...convenient location
reviews.text: If you need to leave early in a car (before 6:30) check with the hotel staff as the car park does not have anyone there until 6:30 and we had some trouble getting out.

just returned from 3 nights at the comfort inn smithfield (on a ladies getaway). Reception staff smiling, friendly and helpful, and let us check into rooms early as they had space. Rooms and bathroom clean, spacious and comfortable with tea and coffee facilities and no problems getting extra milk etc. Location 10 minutes walk from bus station but tram available to end of street if needed, and 10 minute walk into centre (again tram available). Great 'foodie' deli/supermarket next door. Smithfield is a developing area and we were a bit concerned re walking back to the hotel on an evening down some of the side streets but no need as streets well lit and plenty of people about. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: A great bargain

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week in April 2007, very good hotel, clean and modern, very close to Dart line. Takes only 10 mins on Dart to City Centre or 20/25 mins walk.
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it

reviews.text: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Comfort Inn Smithfield and will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Dublin.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it was out of the centre, it was an easy 15 min walk to Temple Bar or 2 stops on the tram which takes about 2 mins. On the first and last days we bought the travel card which includes unlimited travel on the LUAS and the buses so we could use it to get to and from the airport. This was 6.50 Euros which is a bargain as the bus to the airport costs 6 Euros alone.
reviews.title: loved Dublin and The Comfort Inn Smithfield

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms in the hotel are huge and very modern. We had a double and a single bed and we even had a balcony (shame it was too cold to spend much time on it though!). The bathroom was lovely and the shower was out of this world. It was heaven after a hard days shopping!
reviews.title: We loved this hotel!

reviews.text: There's a great shop next to the hotel which sells every sort of food and drink you could need. We got our breakfast from there each morning.
reviews.title: A nice, well-appointed, modern hotel

reviews.text: I can recommend 2 places we ate at while we were there, Farringtons (East Essex Street) and Fans Cantonese (Dame Street). Both served good sized portions and were reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Clean and Modern hotel

likes.disliked: — There are not enough details about car parking facilities and costs on the hotel's website.

description: For outstanding service, a home away from home, competitive rates and city centre location the Maldron Hotel Smithfield is the place for you. The Maldron Hotel Smithfield is a modern and stylish hotel in the heart of Dublin city centre, with the LUAS on the doorstep and only 3 stops away from O Connell Street and 2 stops to Heuston Station. All 92 guest rooms are furnished in a contemporary style with complimentary WIFI access as standard. Many bedrooms feature wall to ceiling glass windows or balconies with panoramic views of the city. Maldron Hotel Smithfield's doors open onto Smithfield Plaza, a vibrant and newly developed quarter of Dublin City Centre. The Stir Restaurant and bar offers an extensive all day dining menu and shows all major sporting events on the big screen. Complimentary WiFi access is offered throughout the hotel. Shopping, entertainment, sightseeing, eateries and business districts within the O'Connell St and Quays area are within an easy stroll from the Hotel with Grafton Street, Temple Bar and Trinity College just a stone's throw away. The O2 theatre, the Bord Gais energy theatre and Croke Park Stadium are very easily accessible. Smithfield's LUAS light rail station is only moments away from the Maldron Hotel Smithfield providing easy access to the airport and main bus & rail stations. Facilities at a glance - Superior 3 star property - City centre location - 92 superior guest rooms and suites - Stir Restaurant - 2 state of the art meeting rooms - Complimentary WIFI access.
